name: Ace of Wands
meanings: The powers which result in these; principle
And in a sense the virility which is behind them; the starting point of enterprises; according to another account
description: A hand issuing from a cloud grasps a stout wand or club.

name: Two of Wands
meanings: Between the alternative readings there is no marriage possible; on the one hand
Mortification The design gives one suggestion; here is a lord overlooking his dominion and alternately contemplating a globe; it looks like the malady
The sadness of Alexander amidst the grandeur of this world's wealth
description: A tall man looks from a battlemented roof over sea and shore; he holds a globe in his right hand, while a staff in his left rests on the battlement; another is fixed in a ring. The Rose and Cross and Lily should be noticed on the left side.

name: Three of Wands
meanings: Which are sailing over the sea The card also signifies able co-operation in business
As if the successful merchant prince were looking from his side towards yours with a view to help you
description: A calm, stately personage, with his back turned, looking from a cliff's edge at ships passing over the sea. Three staves are planted in the ground, and he leans slightly on one of them.

name: Four of Wands
meanings: They are for once almost on the surface--country life
And the perfected work of these
description: From the four great staves planted in the foreground there is a great garland suspended; two female figures uplift nosegays; at their side is a bridge over a moat, leading to an old manorial house.

name: Five of Wands
meanings: But also the strenuous competition and struggle of the search after riches and fortune In this sense it connects with the battle of life. Hence some attributions say that it is a card of gold
description: A posse of youths, who are brandishing staves, as if in sport or strife. It is mimic warfare, and hereto correspond the

name: Six of Wands
meanings: The card has been so designed that it can cover several significations; on the surface
But it is also great news
Such as might be carried in state by the King's courier; it is expectation crowned with its own desire
description: A laurelled horseman bears one staff adorned with a laurel crown; footmen with staves are at his side.

name: Seven of Wands
meanings: It is a card of valour
The vantage position On the intellectual plane
Competition It is further a card of success
For the combatant is on the top and his enemies may be unable to reach him
description: A young man on a craggy eminence brandishing a staff; six other staves are raised towards him from below.

name: Eight of Wands
meanings: As that of an express messenger; great haste
Speed towards an end which promises assured felicity; generally
That which is on the move; also the arrows of love
description: The card represents motion through the immovable-a flight of wands through an open country; but they draw to the term of their course. That which they signify is at hand; it may be even on the threshold.

name: Nine of Wands
meanings: The card signifies strength in opposition If attacked
The person will meet an onslaught boldly; and his build shews
That he may prove a formidable antagonist With this main significance there are all its possible adjuncts--delay
description: The figure leans upon his staff and has an expectant look, as if awaiting an enemy. Behind are eight other staves--erect, in orderly disposition, like a palisade.

name: Ten of Wands
meanings: And some of the readings cannot be harmonized I set aside that which connects it with honour and good faith. The chief meaning is oppression simply
And then it is the oppression of these things It is also a card of false-seeming
Perfidy The place which the figure is approaching may suffer from the rods that he carries. Success is stultified if the Nine of Swords follows
And if it is a question of a lawsuit
description: A man oppressed by the weight of the ten staves which he is carrying.

name: Page of Wands
meanings: He will bear favourable testimony concerning him A dangerous rival
If followed by the Page of Cups Has the chief qualities of his suit. He may signify family intelligence.
description: In a scene similar to the former, a young man stands in the act of proclamation. He is unknown but faithful, and his tidings are strange.

name: Knight of Wands
description: He is shewn as if upon a journey, armed with a short wand, and although mailed is not on a warlike errand. He is passing mounds or pyramids. The motion of the horse is a key to the character of its rider, and suggests the precipitate mood, or things connected therewith.

name: Queen of Wands
meanings: Honourable If the card beside her signifies a man
She is well disposed towards him; if a woman
She is interested in the Querent Also
Or a certain success in business
description: The Wands throughout this suit are always in leaf, as it is a suit of life and animation. Emotionally and otherwise, the Queen's personality corresponds to that of the King, but is more magnetic.

name: King of Wands
meanings: Honest and conscientious The card always signifies honesty
And may mean news concerning an unexpected heritage to fall in before very long
description: The physical and emotional nature to which this card is attributed is dark, ardent, lithe, animated, impassioned, noble. The King uplifts a flowering wand, and wears, like his three correspondences in the remaining suits, what is called a cap of maintenance beneath his crown. He connects with the symbol of the lion, which is emblazoned on the back of his throne.

name: Ace of Wands Reversed
meanings: To perish also a certain clouded joy
description: A hand issuing from a cloud grasps a stout wand or club.

name: Two of Wands Reversed
description: A tall man looks from a battlemented roof over sea and shore; he holds a globe in his right hand, while a staff in his left rests on the battlement; another is fixed in a ring. The Rose and Cross and Lily should be noticed on the left side.

name: Three of Wands Reversed
description: A calm, stately personage, with his back turned, looking from a cliff's edge at ships passing over the sea. Three staves are planted in the ground, and he leans slightly on one of them.

name: Four of Wands Reversed
meanings: The meaning remains unaltered; it is prosperity
description: From the four great staves planted in the foreground there is a great garland suspended; two female figures uplift nosegays; at their side is a bridge over a moat, leading to an old manorial house.

name: Five of Wands Reversed
description: A posse of youths, who are brandishing staves, as if in sport or strife. It is mimic warfare, and hereto correspond the

name: Six of Wands Reversed
meanings: As of a victorious enemy at the gate; treachery
As of gates being opened to the enemy; also indefinite delay
description: A laurelled horseman bears one staff adorned with a laurel crown; footmen with staves are at his side.

name: Seven of Wands Reversed
meanings: Anxiety It is also a caution against indecision.
description: A young man on a craggy eminence brandishing a staff; six other staves are raised towards him from below.

name: Eight of Wands Reversed
meanings: Quarrels; and domestic disputes for persons who are married
description: The card represents motion through the immovable-a flight of wands through an open country; but they draw to the term of their course. That which they signify is at hand; it may be even on the threshold.

name: Nine of Wands Reversed
description: The figure leans upon his staff and has an expectant look, as if awaiting an enemy. Behind are eight other staves--erect, in orderly disposition, like a palisade.

name: Ten of Wands Reversed
description: A man oppressed by the weight of the ten staves which he is carrying.

name: Page of Wands Reversed
meanings: Evil news Also indecision and the instability which accompanies it.
description: In a scene similar to the former, a young man stands in the act of proclamation. He is unknown but faithful, and his tidings are strange.

name: Knight of Wands Reversed
description: He is shewn as if upon a journey, armed with a short wand, and although mailed is not on a warlike errand. He is passing mounds or pyramids. The motion of the horse is a key to the character of its rider, and suggests the precipitate mood, or things connected therewith.

name: Queen of Wands Reversed
meanings: Serviceable Signifies also--but in certain positions and in the neighbourhood of other cards tending in such directions--opposition
description: The Wands throughout this suit are always in leaf, as it is a suit of life and animation. Emotionally and otherwise, the Queen's personality corresponds to that of the King, but is more magnetic.

name: King of Wands Reversed
description: The physical and emotional nature to which this card is attributed is dark, ardent, lithe, animated, impassioned, noble. The King uplifts a flowering wand, and wears, like his three correspondences in the remaining suits, what is called a cap of maintenance beneath his crown. He connects with the symbol of the lion, which is emblazoned on the back of his throne.
